title: How to Start the Conversation
content: Start gently. Pick a relaxed time â€” like during a walk or quiet moment at home. Use open-ended questions and listen without judgment.

title: Talk About Body Changes
content: Let your child know puberty is normal. Use correct terms, stay calm, and answer questions honestly. Avoid shame or fear.

title: Create a Safe Space
content: Let your teen know they can talk to you anytime without getting in trouble. This helps build trust and openness.

title: Respect Privacy
content: Teens need some independence. Respect their space while still guiding them on important matters.

title: When to Seek Help
content: If your child is very withdrawn, angry, or anxious, don't hesitate to talk to a school counselor or psychologist.
